intro: Verbascum varians var. erzindschanense, commonly known as the Erzincan mullein, is a perennial plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or open habitats. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
